availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elijah Connor Phister (Mason County circuit court judge, attorney, and mayor)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, Circuit Court Judge. Maysville, Kentucky, native. Son of Conrad Phister and Mary W. Conner Phister. Graduated from Augusta College in Augusta in 1840. Studied law with John Sargent in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Married to Jane A. Phister. Father of Anna E. Phister, Mary S. Phister, Amelia N. Phister, Thomas R. Phister. Admitted to the bar in 1844. Practiced law in Mason County, with firm of Payne & Waller. Circuit Court Judge in Maysville in 1860. Employed one enslaved person from Joseph B. Lindsey in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, [State], Mason County, District 2, p. 172; Tenkotte, Paul A. and James C. Claypool, eds., The Encyclopedia of Northern Kentucky (Lexington: The University Press of Kentucky, 2009), 715.
